did.unittitle: Stanford University, School of Humanities and Sciences, Humanities Special Programs, records

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Stanford University. School of Humanities and Sciences

did.abstract: Correspondence, minutes, budgets, sample exams, chronologies, and other records largely pertaining to the graduate Honor's Program and Religious Studies. There are also materials pertaining to the Pacific Coast Committee for the Humanities, 1951-67.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University, School of Humanities and Sciences, Humanities Special Programs, Records (SC0096). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Special Programs in Humanities included an undergraduate and graduate Honor's Program in Humanities, Hispanic American Studies, Pacific-Asiatic and Russian Studies, and Religious Studies.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, minutes, budgets, sample exams, chronologies, and other records largely pertaining to the graduate Honor's Program and Religious Studies. There are also materials pertaining to the Pacific Coast Committee for the Humanities, 1951-67. Accession ARCH-2017-085 consists of records regarding the Interdisciplinary Studies in Humanities (ISH) program.
